intro: Elatostema rubrostipulatum, commonly known as the red-stippled elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves with reddish veins. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, dry fruits. Elatostema rubrostipulatum is often found in damp, shaded areas such as forest floors and rock crevices.
